Description: Weight: dīrham weight of 13 kharrūba. Six line inscription on obverse and a one line and two line inscription on the reverse. Made of pale green glass.
Curator's comments: The legend is very similar to that on OA+ 4230 but, while 'thalatha' is spelt correctly the last two letters of dīrham are written to look more or less like 'mīm', 'tooth', 'rā''.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (175)
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Malik b. Yazīd
Named in inscription: Muḥammad b. Shuraḥbīl
